author: Murtha Cullina
title: Governor Hochul Vetoes NYS Non-Compete Bill
text: On December 22, 2023, Governor Kathy Hochul vetoed a bill that would have imposed a ban on non-compete clauses throughout the state of New York for all employees, regardless of earnings level. We wrote about the Senate and Assembly bills that were passed in June, here. Many business groups and trade associations criticized the bills as overbroad and lacking common sense exceptions, such as permitting non-competes in connection with the sale of a business. Although we did not think that the bill would be signed into law as it was drafted, we expected that the Governor and lawmakers would arrive at a compromise and include exceptions, such as banning non-competes for employees who earn below a particular threshold. Previously, Governor Hochul had proposed limiting the ban to individuals who earned in excess of $250,000 in total annual compensation. However, this agreement never materialized. The Governor remains committed to enacting non-compete legislation and State Senator Sean Ryan (D), the bill’s sponsor, vows to reintroduce the bill in the next legislative session. For now, non-compete restrictions are alive and well in New York. See more » DISCLAIMER: Because of the generality of this update, the information provided herein may not be applicable in all situations and should not be acted upon without specific legal advice based on particular situations. © Murtha Cullina Refine your interests »

author: Investing.com
title: Colômbia - Ações fecharam o pregão em alta e o Índice COLCAP avançou 0,20% Por Investing.com
text:
Investing.com – Colômbia - As ações fecharam em alta no pregão de quinta-feira, com ganhos nos setores de Industriais , Serviços e Agropecuária , levando as ações a uma alta.
No encerramento em Colômbia, o Índice COLCAP ganhou 0,20%.
O melhor desempenho da sessão no Índice COLCAP veio das ações da Grupo Argos SA Pref (BVC: ARG_p ), que subiram 2,53%, o que corresponde a 380,00 pontos, sendo negociadas a 15.380,00 no fechamento do pregão. Enquanto isso, as ações da Banco Davivienda Pf (BVC: DVI_p ) adicionaram 2,16%, ou 380,00 pontos, terminando o dia em 17.960,00, e as da Celsia SA (BVC: CEL ), que avançaram 1,40%, ou 50,00 pontos, no final das operações com 3.620,00.
O pior desempenho da sessão foi das ações da Cementos Argos SA (BVC: CCB ), que caiu 2,77% ou 300,00 pontos, com os papéis sendo negociados a 10.520,00 em seu fechamento. Banco De Bogota SA (BVC: BBO ) recuou 1,65%, ou 440,00 pontos, terminando em 26.240,00, e Ecopetrol SA (BVC: ECO ) diminuiu 1,48%, ou 25,00 pontos, para 1.660,00.
As ações em queda superaram os papéis com resultados positivos na Bolsa de valores da Colômbia com uma diferença de 0 a 0.
Os contratos futuros de café contrato C para entrega em março, caíram 1,84%, ou 6,05, para $322,55 . Em outras commodities, cacau NY para entrega em março, recuou 8,23%, ou 976,00, para atingir $10.876,00 , enquanto os futuros de ouro para entrega em fevereiro, avançaram 0,70%, ou 18,32, negociados a $2.653,82 por onça troy.
O par USD/COP retrocedeu 0,40% para 4.395,00, enquanto o par BRL/COP avançou 8,40%, para 711,34.
O Índice Dólar Futuros, por sua vez, aumentou 0,14% em 107,88.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Rainy, windy Friday for NYC; chance for showers on Mother's Day
text:
By News 12 Staff ,
1 hour ago
News 12 Storm Watch Team Meteorologist Hope Osemwenkhae says today will be raw, rainy and chilly. There will be breaks in intense rainfall this afternoon, but it will remain windy with wind chills in the 40s all day.
WHAT TO KNOW:
Steadiest rain is falling now with a chilly gusty wind. Temperatures are in the 50s. Expect wet roads and puddles in low lying and poor drainage areas. Saturday will be the best day this weekend for outdoor plans. Expect sun, clouds, a cool breeze and unseasonably cool temps in the 60s. Mother's Day won't be a washout. There will be a few passing showers during the morning and early afternoon. Drier closer to 3PM, but still cloudy and cool. Milder temps in the 70s with sunshine returns on Monday. Warmer temperatures with a chance of showers and thunderstorms return Tuesday into Wednesday. Storms could be strong Tuesday night into Wednesday. FORECAST:
Today: Raw, chilly and breezy. Steadiest rain in the morning. Highs near 55.
Tonight: Cloudy, chilly and a bit breezy. Lows near 48.
Saturday: Clouds, sun with a cool breeze. Showers arrive late. Highs near 63. Lows near 50.
Sunday (Mother's Day): AM showers, limited sun, and cool. Highs near 60. Lows near 51.
Monday: Mostly sunny and mild. Highs near 72. Lows near 57. Tuesday: Sun and clouds, and milder. Chance of PM storms. Highs near 77. Lows near 58.
Wednesday: Partly sunny, mild. Chance of showers/storms. Highs 71. Lows near 60.
Thursday: Mostly sunny and mild. Highs near 74. Lows near 57.
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

organizations.name: news 12 storm watch team meteorologist hope osemwenkhae

author: ABP News Bureau
title: NCPCR Chief Flags 'Religious Conversion' Of Children In MP's Devash, 2 Tribal Orgs Under Scanner
text:
Priyank Kanoongo, head of the National Commission for the Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR), claimed that during a visit to two missionary groups in the tribal sections of Madhya Pradesh's Dewas district, he saw important persons "involved in the dirty work of converting children," news agency ANI reported. He further claimed that children had memorised Christian religious prayers and threatened to sue under the JJ Act and the Madhya Pradesh Freedom of Religion Act of 2021.
He further claimed that children as young as 10 years old were forced to trim grass and clean toilets on the grounds, and warned that appropriate action would be done by submitting a warning to the Madhya Pradesh Government's Chief Secretary.
On his official social media account, the NCPCR chairman announced his visit to the tribal parts of Dewas district, saying he toured two separate institutions run by misisonary groups.
"Today, during my visit to the tribal areas of Dewas district of Madhya Pradesh, I inspected two different institutions, both of which were being run by missionary organisations," he posted on X.
आज मध्य प्रदेश के देवास जिले के आदिवासी अंचलों में दौरे के दौरान दो अलग-अलग संस्थाओं का निरीक्षण किया दोनों ही संस्थान मिशनरी संस्थाओं द्वारा चलाए जा रहे थे।
जे जे एक्ट की परिभाषा में CNCP बच्चों को पंजीकृत बालगृह में CWC के आदेश से ही रखा जा सकता है,यहाँ इस क़ानून का खुला… pic.twitter.com/u5K1imKzLW
— प्रियंक कानूनगो Priyank Kanoongo (@KanoongoPriyank) December 23, 2023
The Commission for the Protection of Child Rights (CPCR) Act of 2005 established the NCPCR as a statutory entity. The Ministry of Women and Child Development has administrative jurisdiction over it. The commission's mandate is to ensure that all laws, policies, programmes, and administrative procedures are consistent with the vision of children's rights.
Kanoonga noted in his article that children in need of care and protection (CNCP) can only be held in registered children's homes with CWC orders, according to the definition of the JJ Act.
"Here, a blatant violation of this law has been seen as the institutions did not submit the registration documents," he alleged.
"Almost all the children are Hindus; however, the children offer Christian prayers at the institution. The children have learned Christian religious prayers by heart. Innocent children as young as 10 years of age are made to cut grass, sweep and even clean toilets on the premises," he further alleged in his post.
According to the NCPCR chairman, their team discovered "evidence" of "foreign funding" for the institution.
"Our team has also found evidence of foreign funding and high political contacts of the institute; it is clear that influential people in the tribal areas are using their influence to do the dirty work of converting innocent children," he added in his post.
"Due action will be taken by issuing a notice to the Chief Secretary of the Madhya Pradesh Government," he further added in his post.

organizations.name: national commission for the protection of child rights

author: Liam De Brun
title: ‘Quiet natured and caring’ — Tributes pour in for 18-year-old killed in Fermanagh horror crash
text:
Tributes are pouring in for an 18-year-old who was tragically killed in a horror road crash that occurred on Friday in Co Fermanagh.
Oisin Gregg lost his life following a two-vehicle crash on the Letterboy Road in Kesh village on the night of June 7.
The teenager spent several days in hospital following the incident, but sadly passed away earlier in the week.
Tributes are pouring in to an 18-year-old who was tragically killed in a horror road crash that occurred on Friday in Co Fermanagh. Photo: Funeraltimes.com His death notice reads: ‘Forever loved and always missed by mum and dad Mary and Gareth, sister Aoife, brothers Aaron, Callum and Oscar, grandparents, aunties, uncles, cousins, family circle and all his many friends.’
Leading the tributes to Oisin was his former school Belleek Primary School, who said it ‘is with great sadness that we learn of the untimely passing of our past pupil’.
‘Oisin was a quiet natured and caring child with a love for football. As a school community, we are heartbroken for Oisin’s father Gareth, mother Mary, his siblings; Aoife, Aaron, Callum and Oscar (currently in P5).
‘Oisin’s tragic death has devastated the entire community of Belleek, we hope some comfort will be brought to the Gregg family in knowing that we will all do our very best to support you all in the days, weeks, months and even years ahead,’ they said in a statement.
Oisin Gregg lost his live following a two-vehicle crash on the Letterboy Road in Kesh village on the night of June 7. Photo: Facebook. The young man was a member of the North Fermanagh Young Defenders flute band over the last six years, with the group saying they were ‘lucky enough’ to call him their friend.
‘Oisin has been a part of our band since he was 12 years old, he joined up in October 2017, firstly learning to play the flute and then in June 2018, he decided he wanted to try drumming.
‘His first ever parade with the band, was at our annual band parade in Kesh on Fri 6th September 2019, his last parade with the band was just earlier this year, at the Easter Monday ABOD parade in Enniskillen. We can only thank him for his effort, commitment and also for simply choosing us to share so many memorable times together.
‘He will be sadly missed and always remembered by all of his NFYD family. We send our sincere condolences to Oisin’s family and entire family circle at this tough time and they will remain in our thoughts and prayers throughout this difficult time,’ they said.
Oisin will be reposing at Ballycassidy House Funeral Home on Friday, June 14, from 3pm to 9pm, before being removed to his family home later that night.
Mourners will gather at Slavin Parish Church for his funeral mass on Saturday, June 15, at 2pm.
‘Family flowers only, please; donations in lieu if so desired to Air Ambulance c/o any family member or Peter Carty Funeral Director,’ an online note reads
Anyone who wishes to watch Oisin’s funeral mass can do so here .
